content.question: Which of the following scenarios best represents the model for straight ticket voting?

choices.label: A citizen votes for the candidate who has promised to help her business.
A citizen votes for the incumbent candidate because his income has increased over the past two years.
Despite not recognizing the name, a candidate votes for the Democratic Party candidate because he is a Democrat.
A citizen who owns a lot of property bases her vote on the candidate's promise to lower property taxes.

content.answer: Despite not recognizing the name, a candidate votes for the Democratic Party candidate because he is a Democrat.

topic.text: 5.1: Voting Rights and Models of Voting Behavior
